problem.markdown:
Which of the following is not true about qubits? ( ) A qubit derives its 'name from quantum bit' ( ) A qubit can exist in both '0' and '1' states at the same time (x) A qubit is an arrangement of four bits ( ) The qubit is the fundamental building block of a quantum computer
[explanation] A qubit works exactly like a bit in that it can take the values od 0 or 1, but also has a third superposition state of 0 and 1. [explanation]
problem.p: Which of the following is not true about qubits?

choicegroup.choice: A qubit derives its 'name from quantum bit'
A qubit can exist in both '0' and '1' states at the same time
A qubit is an arrangement of four bits
The qubit is the fundamental building block of a quantum computer

div.p: A qubit works exactly like a bit in that it can take the values od 0 or 1, but also has a third superposition state of 0 and 1.
